author: TravisEz13
body:
## PR Summary

#8196 PR was causing test failures.
This reverts commit b525b1f0bde65f0c59ccd9bbfe25d1459fcff1a3 to resolve that failure

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10873629/48370458-3bde1000-e66e-11e8-8da6-f50c550dfac7.png)


## PR Checklist

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [x] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **User-facing changes**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] User-facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed - Issue link:
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [x] Not Applicable or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
        - [ ] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)

comments.author: bugale
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 Do you know the environment for running the test?
When I run it on my machine using "Start-PSPester -Path .\test\powershell\Host\ConsoleHost.Tests.ps1" it passes:
`

    Context Redirected standard input for 'interactive' use
      [?] Interactive redirected input: <empty> 41ms
      [?] Interactive redirected input:  -IntERactive 5ms
      [?] Interactive redirected input:  -i 3ms
      [?] Interactive redirected input w/ initial command 3ms
      [?] Redirected input explicit prompting (-File -) 3ms
      [?] Redirected input no prompting (-Command -) 3ms
      [?] Redirected input w/ nested prompt 5ms
      [+] Redirected input and sending backspace 1.42s
`

I see that it also passed on the automations on Windows.
What is "continuous-integration/appveyor/branch"?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: This was failing in our CI system.  if you prefix a commit with `[feature]` it will run the tests.

comments.author: bugale
comments.body:
> This was failing in our CI system. if you prefix a commit with `[feature]` it will run the tests.

@TravisEz13 
Your CI system also runs it on Windows/linux/max, in which the test passed.
Anyway, in order to investigate the fail I need to reproduce the failure, but I wasn't able to since it passes on my computer. This is why I ask which environment is used for the appveyor test.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Appveyor is a Windows environment IIRC.

But the point is that not all tests are run by default as it is usually not needed and can be time consuming. Certain tests will only be run by the build system when a commit made with `[feature]` string is the trigger for the CI, although I'm not fully clear on the fine details of how that is implemented. 😄

comments.author: bugale
comments.body:
That specific test was run on the "Windows" CI tests and passed (from my PR).
How can someone debug a failure on appveyor?

title: Fix test failure due to "Ignoring backspace for empty lines on stdin/stdout mode (#8196)"
